Storchi Pozzoferrato Lambrusco Is The Perfect Pizza Wine | Bon Appétit

But beer is too filling and soda is for kids! That’s where sparkling wine comes in. Sparkling wine and pizza go together like Bradley Cooper and Lady Gaga, which is to say, they go together perfectly. And there’s one in particular that’s become the non plus ultra for pairing in my book: a not-too-sweet lambrusco made by Gianna Storchi in Emilia Romagna, Italy, called Pozzoferrato. The first time I tried it was at Scarr’s, the old-school pizza spot that mills its own flour to the tune of throwback hip-hop in New York’s Lower East Side. As I made my way down the list of Hennessy Coladas and cheap beer, I stumbled upon something listed as a “Red Pet Nat.” So I ordered it—and have every visit since. Nothing beats its clean finish, which will please Two Buck Chuck folks and natty wine freaks alike. And of course, there’s that gratifying effervescence that also feels celebratory, even if it’s just a Tuesday night in the back of a slice shop. It’s so good, I won’t eat pizza without it—or at least something just like it. Can’t find the bottle?
